elements.title: George Jenkins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Jenkins (pictured) was described in 1901 as "the happiest, proudest, most important and most worried individual" in Australia, but 90 years later as "a lazy, dictatorial, unctuous opportunist"?

elements.title: Golden State Valkyries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Golden State Valkyries are the first expansion franchise in the WNBA since 2008?

elements.title: a 2021 Dutch translation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 2021 Dutch translation of the Bible introduces five new animals?

elements.title: Freedom from Fear: The American People in Depression and War, 1929–1945 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Freedom from Fear: The American People in Depression and War, 1929–1945, "the 'American people' appear with conspicuous infrequency"?

elements.title: Julian Prégardien (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julian Prégardien's performance as the Evangelist in Bach's St Matthew Passion was noted by one reviewer for its emphatic and penetrating "profoundly human" nature?

elements.title: Teeth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The New York Times called Teeth a "feminist awakening with a lethal bite"?

elements.title: Debbie Currie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Debbie Currie once worked as a lollipop lady?

elements.title: Missoula Children's Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Missoula Children's Theatre works with more than 65,000 children every year?

elements.title: Thourots became the Brewers, who became the Palaces, who became the Jackaways, who became the Mules, who then disbanded (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in two years the Thourots became the Brewers, who became the Palaces, who became the Jackaways, who became the Mules, who then disbanded?
